sn23.1:1.2: Then Venerable Rādha went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn23.1:2.1: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘Māra’.
sn23.1:2.3: “When there is form, Rādha, there may be Māra, or the murderer, or the murdered.
sn23.1:2.4: So you should see form as Māra, the murderer, the murdered, the diseased, the boil, the dart, the gloom, the gloominess.
sn23.1:2.5: Those who see it like this see rightly.
sn23.1:2.9: consciousness, there may be Māra, or the murderer, or the murdered.
sn23.1:2.10: So you should see consciousness as Māra, the murderer, the murdered, the diseased, the boil, the dart, the gloom, the gloominess.
sn23.1:2.11: Those who see it like this see rightly.”
sn23.1:3.1: “But sir, what’s the purpose of seeing rightly?”
sn23.1:3.2: “Disillusionment is the purpose of seeing rightly.”
sn23.1:3.9: “But sir, what is the purpose of extinguishment?”
sn23.1:3.10: “Your question goes too far, Rādha. You couldn’t figure out the limit of questions.
sn23.1:3.11: For extinguishment is the culmination, destination, and end of the spiritual life.”
